abstract: <jats:p>We revise the Oriental species of Bruchomyiinae based on type and additional material, with first descriptions of the genus<jats:italic>Alexanderia</jats:italic>Wagner & Kvifte,<jats:bold>gen. nov.</jats:bold>and<jats:italic>A. thailandensis</jats:italic>Wagner, Rulik & Polseela,<jats:bold>sp.nov.</jats:bold>The genus further comprises<jats:italic>Nemapalpus orientalis</jats:italic>Edwards, 1928 (type species),<jats:italic>Nemopalpus vietnamensis</jats:italic>Quate, 1962 and<jats:italic>Nemapalpus unicolor</jats:italic>Edwards, 1928.<jats:italic>Alexanderia thailandensis</jats:italic>is described using morphology of males and females and DNA barcodes, whereas<jats:italic>A. orientalis</jats:italic>Edwards, 1928<jats:bold>comb.nov.</jats:bold>,<jats:italic>A. unicolor</jats:italic>Edwards 1928<jats:bold>comb.nov.</jats:bold>, and<jats:italic>A. vietnamensis</jats:italic>Quate 1962<jats:bold>comb. nov.</jats:bold>are redescribed. The male and female internal genitalia in the genus are discussed in the context of sexual selection, and we suggest that the spermathecal ducts of the female and the basiphallic musculature of the male may be shaped by a male/female coevolutionary arms race.</jats:p>
title: Revision of Bruchomyiinae (Diptera, Psychodidae) of the Oriental Region, with description of a new genus and species and discussion of putative male/female antagonistic coevolution
